content: Is there a particular reason the MCP template does not cc @rust-lang/compiler or @rust-lang/compiler-contributors? I know there are mentions on Zulip for the MCPs, but I find it easier to keep track of GH notifications. Would anyone object to adding a cc at the bottom of the template?
Will it work if someone outside of the rust-lang org opens an issue?
That's a good point; I suppose it won't.
I guess a bot would do the trick, but this is probably good enough for now: https://github.com/rust-lang/compiler-team/pull/369
OTOH I guess most MCPs are opened by org members? Maybe it's not even worth it to try to add a bot
Also, since WG-prioritization goes through MCPs to add them to the weekly meeting agenda, maybe whoever handles the agenda could occasionally do the ping
I'd say add it to the bot
@simulacrum can point at the sources I imagine
https://github.com/rust-lang/triagebot/blob/master/src/handlers/major_change.rs#L187, though you might need to special case compiler or add it to configuration
If compiler-team#372 seems fine, could someone merge it?
